Panel Name

fwElmbCANbusCreate.pnl
Introduction
 This panel is used to create a new CAN Bus in the system. The user can also choose to have the default settings for addressing applied at the time the device is created.
Instructions To create a CAN bus one has to (Figure 1):
  1. Enter a name for the bus in the 'Bus Name' field. It is recommended to enter a name that indicates some properties of the CAN bus for ease of recognition. For example, a CAN bus on port 1 of a Kvaser CAN interface card could be named KV_BUS_1.
  2. A comment may be entered to associate more information with this bus. Any text is allowed (including spaces). This field is optional (i.e. may be left blank).
  3. Select which CAN interface card type this bus will be connected to and the port number from the section entitled 'Interface Type and Port Number'. Please note that only ports NOT already used will be available.
  4. Select a bus speed from the 'Bus Speed' drop-down list. Note that the default baud rate (bus speed) for the ELMB is 125Kbits/s.
  5. Select whether the default OPC addressing should be applied. This is highly recommended, and a warning will be given if you deselect this option from the checkbox to ensure you really want to do this.
  6. Click the button labeled 'Create' to create the CAN bus with the selected options. A progress bar will inform of the progress during the operation.
Restrictions

Name Description  
$sDpName Name of the parent device where the new CAN bus will be added. This is normally the ELMB vendor node. Required
